FuncDef:
The active nat session-table size command sets the number of session tables that can be established on the CPUs of VSUF-80/VSUF-160/VSUI-160-E/VSUI-400/VSUI-400-E/VSUI-400A/VSUI-400A-E/VSUI-400-S/VSUI-400A-Ss.
The undo active nat session-table size command deletes the number of session tables that can be established on the CPUs of VSUF-80/VSUF-160/VSUI-160-E/VSUI-400/VSUI-400-E/VSUI-400A/VSUI-400A-E/VSUI-400-S/VSUI-400A-Ss.
The default number of session tables that can be established on the CPUs of VSUF-80/VSUF-160/VSUI-160-E/VSUI-400/VSUI-400-E/VSUI-400A/VSUI-400A-E/VSUI-400-S/VSUI-400A-S is 0, and services are unavailable.
CLIs: active nat session-table size <table-size> slot <slot-id> { engine <engine-id> | card <card-id> }
undo active nat session-table size [ <table-size> ] slot <slot-id> { engine <engine-id> | card <card-id> }
undo active nat session-table size slot <slot-id>

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the maximum number of NAT session tables that can be created.
The value is an enumerated integer type. The value range is 2 to 32. The value is an integer multiple of two. The unit is M (M = 1024 x 1024).
If the license resources are sufficient, setting the size of a NAT session table to 32M is recommended.

Specifies the slot ID of a service board.
The value is a string of 1 to 15 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Specifies the base-board CPU ID of a service board. This parameter takes effect only on a VSUF-80/VSUF-160/VSUI-160-E/VSUI-400/VSUI-400-E/VSUI-400A/VSUI-400A-E/VSUI-400-S/VSUI-400A-S.
The value is an integer equal 0 for VSUF-80.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 1 for VSUF-160,VSUI-160-E,VSUI-400A/VSUI-400.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 3 for VSUI-400A-E/VSUI-400-E.
The value is an integer equal 0 for VSUI-400-S/VSUI-400A-S.

Specifies a CPU ID of a subcard.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 1.

Examples: [~HUAWEI-license] active nat session-table size 2 slot 1 engine 1
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
A license file controls the maximum number of sessions that can be created on VSUF-80/VSUF-160/VSUI-160-E/VSUI-400/VSUI-400-E/VSUI-400A/VSUI-400A-E/VSUI-400-S/VSUI-400A-S. After you load and activate a CGN license file, the device assigns session table resources to CPUs of service boards based on the active nat session-table size command.
Precautions
The active nat session-table size command takes effect only on VSUF-80/VSUF-160/VSUI-160-E/VSUI-400/VSUI-400-E/VSUI-400A/VSUI-400A-E/VSUI-400-S/VSUI-400A-S.On VSUF-80s and VSUF-160s, the value can be 2 to 16. The value is an integer multiple of two. The unit is M.On VSUI-160-Es,  VSUI-400A/VSUI-400s and  VSUI-400A-E/VSUI-400-Es, the value can be 2 to 32. The value is an integer multiple of two. The unit is M.In this command, M indicates 1024 x 1024. For example, if the maximum number of sessions that can be created is set to 2M, a maximum of 2 x 1024 x 1024 sessions can be created.
